headline: Lead time depends on season, camp popularity, and flexibility
summary: Peak season (July-October, Christmas) at popular camps requires 6-12 months advance booking. Shoulder and green seasons can be booked 2-4 months ahead. Last-minute deals exist but limit options significantly. The more specific your requirements (dates, camps, activities), the earlier you should book.

assumptions.text: Peak season at popular camps requires 6-12 months advance booking.
Shoulder and green seasons can typically be booked 2-4 months ahead.
Last-minute bookings are possible but limit camp and date options.

gains: Early booking: Best camp and date selection
Early booking: Flight prices often lower
Flexibility: More options at any lead time
losses: Early booking: Less flexibility to change
Early booking: Deposit required long in advance
Last-minute: Limited options, no top camps

change_conditions: If traveling peak season, book 9-12 months ahead.
If flexible on dates and camps, 2-3 months may suffice.
If specific camps are essential, check their typical booking window.
If budget allows last-minute flexibility, deals can appear 4-6 weeks out.
